New Records: García hit 15 RBIs in a postseason series, the most ever.
Key Match Events: García hit a grand slam in the ninth inning of Game 6
García went 4-for-5 with two homers, a stolen base and five RBIs in Game 7
García stole second base in the first inning of Game 7
Pre-Game Insights: Rangers manager Chris Young stated that García is 'in the upper echelon now, closing in on pretty much any superstar you can name.'
Post-Match Reflections: García said he was focused solely on Game 7 and didn't want to say anything that would get him off track.
Players and coaches praised García's leadership and popularity within the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: García was booed loudly in Game 6 after hitting a three-run homer and then being hit by a pitch from Bryan Abreu
García declined to speak to the media after Game 6 but was available for interviews after Game 7
